Views¶

This section documents the views that handle HTTP requests.

Bases: GenericAPIView

API endpoint: POST /api/articles/<id>/approve/ Editors approve articles and notify subscribers.

class news.views.ArticleViewSet(**kwargs)¶

Bases: ModelViewSet

Handles CRUD operations for articles via REST API.

approve(request, pk=None)¶
get_permissions()¶

Instantiates and returns the list of permissions that this view requires.

get_queryset()¶

Get the list of items for this view. This must be an iterable, and may be a queryset. Defaults to using self.queryset.

This method should always be used rather than accessing self.queryset directly, as self.queryset gets evaluated only once, and those results are cached for all subsequent requests.

You may want to override this if you need to provide different querysets depending on the incoming request.

(Eg. return a list of items that is specific to the user)

perform_create(serializer)¶
serializer_class¶

alias of ArticleSerializer

subscribed(request)¶
class news.views.IsEditorOrOwner¶

Bases: BasePermission

Custom permission: editors can delete any article, journalists can delete their own articles.

Return True if permission is granted, False otherwise.

class news.views.SubscribedArticleView(**kwargs)¶

Bases: ListAPIView

API endpoint: GET /api/articles/subscribed/ Returns articles from subscribed journalists and publishers.

get_queryset()¶

Get the list of items for this view. This must be an iterable, and may be a queryset. Defaults to using self.queryset.

This method should always be used rather than accessing self.queryset directly, as self.queryset gets evaluated only once, and those results are cached for all subsequent requests.

You may want to override this if you need to provide different querysets depending on the incoming request.

(Eg. return a list of items that is specific to the user)

permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>, <class 'news.permissions.IsReader'>]¶
serializer_class¶

alias of ArticleSerializer

news.views.approve_publisher_request(request, pk)¶

Editor action to approve a journalist’s request to join a publisher. Adds journalist to the publisher and marks request as approved.

news.views.article_detail(request, pk)¶
news.views.article_list(request)¶

Role-aware article list: - Readers: approved articles only - Journalists: all their own articles (approved + drafts) - Editors: all articles (approved + drafts)

news.views.editor_pending_articles(request)¶
news.views.home(request)¶
news.views.is_editor(user)¶
news.views.is_reader(user)¶
news.views.manage_subscriptions(request)¶
news.views.publisher_request_list(request)¶

View for journalists to see a list of publishers they are not yet affiliated with.

news.views.publisher_requests_pending(request)¶

Editor view to see all pending publisher affiliation requests.

news.views.register(request)¶

Handle user registration. Allows users to choose a role (reader, journalist, editor).

news.views.request_publisher_affiliation(request, pk)¶

Handle the action of a journalist requesting affiliation with a specific publisher.

news.views.subscribe_journalist(request, *args, **kwargs)¶
news.views.subscribe_journalist_html(request, pk)¶

Subscribe the logged-in user to a journalist and redirect to the subscription management page.

news.views.subscribe_publisher(request, *args, **kwargs)¶
news.views.subscribe_publisher_html(request, pk)¶

Subscribe the logged-in user to a publisher and redirect to the subscription management page.

news.views.subscribed_articles(request)¶

Show articles from journalists and publishers the reader is subscribed to.

news.views.unsubscribe_journalist(request, *args, **kwargs)¶
news.views.unsubscribe_journalist_html(request, pk)¶

Unsubscribe the logged-in user from a journalist and redirect to the subscription management page.

news.views.unsubscribe_publisher(request, *args, **kwargs)¶
news.views.unsubscribe_publisher_html(request, pk)¶

Unsubscribe the logged-in user from a publisher and redirect to the subscription management page.
